question: What did the poor widow find under a pile of brush?
answer1: an egg

question: What was the poor widow doing when she found the egg?
answer1: gathering kindlings in the forest

question: Where did she place the egg?
answer1: under a goose

question: Who came out of the egg when it hatched?
answer1: a little boy

question: How tall was Knos when he was five years old?
answer1: taller than the tallest man

question: What did the town authorities say the poor widow must do?
answer1: apprentice the boy at a trade

question: Why did must the boy be apprenticed at a trade?
answer1: He was big enough and strong enough to earn his own keep.
answer4: He was big and strong enough to earn his own keep.

question: Why was the smith glad to give Knos all three suits and all three swords at once?
answer1: He smashed all his iron and steel to bits.
answer4: Knos smashed all of his iron and steel to bits.

question: Where did Knos go after he received his suits and swords?
answer1: a knight's estate

question: Why did Knos sit at the table eating long after the others had driven off?
answer1: He was very strong and did not need to rush.
answer2: He did not need much time to gather firewood.
answer3: He would be able to complete the task quickly.

question: What did Knos do when he went into the forest?
answer1: seized the two largest trees growing there, tore them out by the roots, took one tree under each arm, and carried them back to the estate
answer4: seized and carried back two of the largest trees back to the estate

question: What will his master do after Knos almost killed him?
answer1: send Knos away

question: What happened because Knos's master thought he was a dangerous fellow?
answer1: Knos was called in, and paid his wages for the full year, on condition that he leave.
answer4: The master paid Knos his wages on the condition that he left.

question: What did Knos say he must be before leaving?
answer1: decently provisioned for his journey
answer4: be decently provisioned for his journey

question: What did Knos do when the bull charged at him?
answer1: grasped him by the horns and flung him over his shoulder
answer2: slaughtered the bull, roasted him and ate him together with a batch of bread

question: Why did great sorrow reign at the king's court?
answer1: The king owed his three daughters to a sea troll.
answer2: The king must give his daughters to the sea-troll.
answer3: The king promised his daughters to the sea-troll.
answer4: The king had to promise the sea troll his three daughters.

question: Who was the only man who wanted to earn the reward?
answer1: Red Peter

question: Why was the cook glad to let Knos go?
answer1: When he had to rinse the dishes, he broke the king's vessels of gold and silver.

answer5: brought in a whole wagon-load of firewood at once

question: How did the princess feel as she stood on the sea-shore?
answer1: sad

answer2: She did not have confidence in Red Peter.
answer4: could see what she had to expect

question: How did Knos save the two princesses?
answer1: chopped off all of the troll's heads

answer4: cut off all of the trolls' heads

answer1: a man carrying a church on his back
